Detailed Description

The service broker allows to retrieve a specific kind of service which is identified by a global unique identifier (GUID). All available services are registered to the service broker. For more details about a service have a look at the class Service.

See also:
Service

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef LinkedList<Service> ServiceBroker::ServiceList
 

Member Function Documentation

ServiceBroker * ServiceBroker::GetBroker (   )  [static]
 

Returns a pointer to the service broker instance. Usually a service broker will be always available, but checking for 0 is mandatory.

Service * ServiceBroker::GetService (  const Guid &  guid  ) 
 

Returns a pointer to the service which is specified by the given GUID. If the service is not available, 0 is returned. It is recommended to use the ServicePtr, which automatically does a cast to the service interface: ServicePtr<MyService> service = broker->GetService(MyService::GUID);

BOOLEAN ServiceBroker::IsServiceSupported (  const Guid &  guid  ) 
 

Returns TRUE, if the service with the given GUID is available.

void ServiceBroker::RegisterService (  Service *  service  )
